18.heading: Rota, Matt.
18.title: Nature of the Beast
18.author: by Adam Mansbach and Douglas Mcgowan ; art by Owen Brozman ; color by Matt Rota with Eric Collins & Stavros Pavlides.
notes: "An alien race of religious extremists plans to honor their deity through the ritualistic annihilation of our planet. The only man who knows this is Milan Marlowe, an unstoppable media baron who sees opportunity everywhere. Earth's only move is to engage the invaders according to their holy law and issue The Challenge of the Heretic

a winner-take-all gladiator battle for our right to exist. Marlowe launches Beast Wars, a televised interspecies tournament designed to select Earth's mightiest champion. On a decadent private island, sharks, lions, gorillas, and polar bears square off to the delight of screaming fans oblivious to the sky-high stakes. Enter Bruno Bolo

single father, blues belter, and alligator wrestler from the swamps of Florida. Beset by personal demons, corporatized killer sharks, Yeats-quoting pit fighters, and looming alien eradicators, Bruno will emerge as our desperate planet's final hope."

54.heading: Roth, Aldo.
54.title: Espers : Black Magic
54.author: by James D
notes: "Tracy King is possessed by the evil spirit of Aldo Roth. Roth was a powerful necromancer who wanted to usher the world into an age of darkness. Now he's back to finish the job he started in 1775. Roth leads a band of occult assassins out to kill the Espers. Brian Marx has other ideas. Brian was Tracy's boyfriend. He's also a Random Mage. Brian can turn ordinary objects into magical weapons. When Brian teams up with the Espers to stop Roth, things literally go to hell."

59.heading: Roth, Arnold, 1929-
59.title: Humbug
59.author: editor, Harvey Kurtzman.
notes: "'Artist credits are given in italics. Writing credits are not given except for outside contibutors, because no records were kept as to who wrote what. Although Arnold Roth generally wrote the material he illustrated, he also wrote material that he didn't illustrate and occasionally illustrated material written by others. With some exceptions, Al Jaffee nearly always wrote the material he drew, but probably did not write material for other artists. Jack Davis and Will Elder did not write. All material not written by Roth, Jaffee or authors specifically credited in these volumes is presumed to have been written by Harvey Kurtzman. Arnold Roth drew all the masthead designs on the contents pages, which are not listed individually. A handful of drawings are not signed. We have done our best to determine who drew these in consultation with Arnold Roth, Al Jaffee, and Russ Heath'

146.title: Blood in the Game
146.author: Brian Wood, writer ; Riccardo Burchielli, artist ; Jeromy Cox, colorist ; Jared K
146.appears_in: Fletcher, letterer ; introduction by Greg Palast.
notes: Originally published in single magazine form as DMZ 29-34, 2008.

Summary (from SkyRiver): As Matty Roth, aspiring photojournalist, continues his to report on the struggle of the civilians caught in this no-man's-land during the Second American Civil War, he encounters a new complication
Parco Delgado, a political rebel participating in the first election in the DMZ.

147.heading: Roth, Matty.
147.title: Free States Rising
147.author: writer, Brian Wood ; Riccardo Burchielli, Shawn Martinbrough, artists ; Jeromy Cox, colorist ; Jared K
147.appears_in: Fletcher, letterer ; created by Brian Wood and Riccardo Burchielli.
notes: Originally published in single magazine form as DMZ 60-66, 2011.

Summary (from SkyRiver): As the war enters its final weeks Matty Roth is given a golden opportunity to report once again from the DMZ, not as a network lackey but as an unbiased observer for the court of world opinion, to ensure both sides stay honest. He is determined to do right by the city where he once failed miserably.

148.heading: Roth, Matty.
148.title: Friendly Fire
148.author: Brian Wood, writer ; Riccardo Burchielli, et al
148.appears_in: , artists ; Jeremy Cox ; colorist ; Jared K. Fletcher, colorist ; introduction by John G. Ford.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form as DMZ 18-22."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Matty Roth reluctantly lands an interview for Liberty News with an enlisted U.S. soldier who's found guilty of a massacre within the DMZ. What follows is a look at how the DMZ came to be, from the perspective of a kid who came from the Midwest and walked right into a nightmare.

149.heading: Roth, Matty.
149.title: Public Works
149.author: Brian Wood, writer ; Riccardo Burchielli, artist ; introduction, Cory Doctorow.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form as DMZ 13-17."
Summary (from SkyRiver): Matty Roth, aspiring photojournalist, continues his one-man mission to report on the war behind the war

the struggle of the civilians caught in this no-man's-land during the Second American Civil War. He's gone deep undercover, posing as an unskilled worker to infilitrate the ranks of Trustwell, Inc., the winner of a lucrative no-bid contract to rebuild Manhattan. Of course he suspects there is more to the situation than meets the eye, but is he prepared for exactly what he might find, or how far he needs to go to find it?
